pullRequest.body:
Shows that locally path-connected spaces are locally connected, and that quotients and disjoint unions of locally path-connected spaces are locally path-connected.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->
Aside from just being useful instances in general, the reason I wanted quotients and disjoint unions in particular is that those are what is needed to show both that the category of locally path-connected spaces is coreflective in Top, and that delta-generated spaces are locally path-connected. I have already shown the latter in another repository.
- [x] depends on: #16983
[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [a969261094](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17064/commits/a969261094352ee020420535b132e2da3761556d)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ IsOpen.pathComponentIn`
`+ LocPathConnectedSpace.coinduced`
`+ Quot.locPathConnectedSpace`
`+ Quotient.locPathConnectedSpace`
`+ Sigma.locPathConnectedSpace`
`+ Sum.locPathConnectedSpace.{u}`
`+ Topology.IsQuotientMap.locPathConnectedSpace`
`+ instance : LocallyConnectedSpace X := by`
`+ isOpen_isPathConnected_basis`
`+ locPathConnectedSpace_iff_isOpen_pathComponentIn`
`+ locPathConnectedSpace_iff_pathComponentIn_mem_nhds`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

That should be all the suggested style changes applied, I think. I'm not sure if I've done this correctly, since it's my first time setting up a chain of dependent PRs - I hope adding the changes from the previous PR as well was right?

> * can this be used to golf the analogous results for connected spaces? (Or would that require importing path-connectedness for connectedness; perhaps that is not desirable.)

Topology.Connected.PathConnected already imports Topology.Connected.LocallyConnected transitively through [Topology.CompactOpen](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/CompactOpen.html), [Topology.ContinuousFunction.Basic](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/ContinuousFunction/Basic.html) and [Topology.Homeomorph](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/Homeomorph.html), so I think adding an import in the other direction wouldn't work. It would probably be good to untangle some of those imports, for example by moving [Homeomorph.locallyConnectedSpace](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/Homeomorph.html#Homeomorph.locallyConnectedSpace) to Topology.Connected.LocallyConnected. But either way, I don't see how results about path-connected spaces could help with general connected spaces - is there anything specific you had in mind?

The one place where I do see golfing potential is the other lemmas on locally path-connected spaces, that were already in this file - I didn't touch them because I wanted to keep the PR small, but could also try golfing them a bit if you want.

> This goes beyond your PR: can one use this to prove that manifolds are locally path-connected (and more generally, charted spaces are if modelled on a locally path-connected space), see #7825? If you'd like to prove that, I'll be happy to review that PR :-)

Done now in https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17142 :)

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#16983~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
Would you like to fix the merge conflicts (whenever you have time, no pressure)? I can review this when it's ready.
Sounds good - I'm a bit busy now, but will probably find time for it next week.

The merge conflicts should be fixed now - I kept the lemmas from #17855 in favour of their variants from this PR, and also changed the names of other lemmas in this PR to better fit them / be more descriptive.
I think the failure about the summary comment should "fix itself" by merging master.

> I think the failure about the summary comment should "fix itself" by merging master.

Looks like it - at least the job that failed previously already completed now.

By the way, what is the etiquette for when the awaiting-author tag should be removed? Once all requested changes are pushed, or only once CI is also complete?

> By the way, what is the etiquette for when the awaiting-author tag should be removed? Once all requested changes are pushed, or only once CI is also complete?

The former, I'd say. If you're sure if CI is going to pass/expect some more rounds with CI might be needed, you can set the `awaiting-CI` label. Sometimes you're quite sure that CI should pass, and then I wouldn't set it either.

Thanks! :tada:
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11917455586/job/33212545570)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11917455586/job/33212546112)

I just took a look at these changes as well. Apart from my style comments, I wonder:
- can this be used to golf the analogous results for connected spaces? (Or would that require importing path-connectedness for connectedness; perhaps that is not desirable.)

This goes beyond your PR: can one use this to prove that manifolds are locally path-connected (and more generally, charted spaces are if modelled on a locally path-connected space), see #7825? If you'd like to prove that, I'll be happy to review that PR :-)
Looks good, thanks!
One small question from me also. Otherwise, looks ready!

A theorem name should match the names of its elements. So, use `isOpen` instead of `open`, and `isPathConnected` instead of `pathConnected`. This makes it much easier to find the lemma later on if we follow this rule in a rather strict way.

I picked this name because the name was already somewhat long, and similar lemmas like [locallyConnectedSpace_iff_open_connected_basis](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/Connected/LocallyConnected.html#locallyConnectedSpace_iff_open_connected_basis) also use the shortened versions. I can change it in a moment though
Yes, we still have some lemmas in the library using shortened names, but this dates from times before we settled on the convention and now we fix them slowly.
#19209 renames these two declarations, by the way.
Why do you have both a version for `Quot` and `Quotient`? I'm really asking because I don't know.

Honestly, I'm not sure either - I just saw it being done like this for compact spaces, with both [Quot.compactSpace](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/Compactness/Compact.html#Quot.compactSpace) and [Quotient.compactSpace](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/Compactness/Compact.html#Quotient.compactSpace) existing. My understanding is that while `Quot` and `Quotient` are mathematically the same thing, both come up in lean in slightly different contexts, and if you just register the instance for one type it won't be able to infer it for the other. I'm actually using neither instance though, the main theorem I need in further PRs is `LocPathConnectedSpace.coinduced`.
`Quotient` isn't reducible, so Lean can't reuse instances about `Quot` for `Quotient`.
Please also add an instance for `Sum`. BTW, you may want to generalize the instance `[NormedSpace Real V] : LocPathConnectedSpace V` to `LocallyConvexSpace`.

I've added the instance for `Sum` now - its proof seems currently a bit redundant, but is the cleanest of several variants I tried.

A `LocPathConnectedSpace`-instance for locally convex spaces is also in #17142 already which is only blocked by this PR, so I don't think there is much point in moving it here.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Topology/Connected/PathConnected): some instances for locally path-connected spaces
